verses.verse: A Psalm of David.<WH1732> I will praise<WH3034> thee with my whole<WH3605> heart:<WH3820> before<WH5048> the gods<WH430> will I sing praise<WH2167> unto thee.

I will worship<WH7812> toward<WH413> thy holy<WH6944> temple,<WH1964> and praise<WH3034> <WH853> thy name<WH8034> for<WH3588> thy lovingkindness<WH2617> and for<WH5921> thy truth:<WH571> for<WH3588> thou hast magnified<WH1431> thy word<WH565> above<WH5921> all<WH3605> thy name.<WH8034>
In the day<WH3117> when I cried<WH7121> thou answeredst<WH6030> me, and strengthenedst<WH7292> me with strength<WH5797> in my soul.<WH5315>
All <WH3605> the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> shall praise<WH3034> thee, O LORD,<WH3068> when<WH3588> they hear<WH8085> the words<WH561> of thy mouth.<WH6310>
Yea, they shall sing<WH7891> in the ways<WH1870> of the LORD:<WH3068> for<WH3588> great<WH1419> is the glory<WH3519> of the LORD.<WH3068>
Though <WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> be high,<WH7311> yet hath he respect<WH7200> unto the lowly:<WH8217> but the proud<WH1364> he knoweth<WH3045> afar off.<WH4480> <WH4801>

Though <WH518> I walk<WH1980> in the midst<WH7130> of trouble,<WH6869> thou wilt revive<WH2421> me: thou shalt stretch forth<WH7971> thine hand<WH3027> against<WH5921> the wrath<WH639> of mine enemies,<WH341> and thy right hand<WH3225> shall save<WH3467> me.

The LORD<WH3068> will perfect<WH1584> that which concerneth<WH1157> me: thy mercy,<WH2617> O LORD,<WH3068> endureth forever:<WH5769> forsake<WH7503> not<WH408> the works<WH4639> of thine own hands.<WH3027>
